page.title: 07BLACK COUNTRY DIALECTS
page.content:
"Yo cor spake like we con, con ya?" may seem like a foreign language but it is normal in the Quarry Bank and Brierley Hill area. Or as known to us, "Quarry Bonk and Brierley Bonk".
Most children in these areas have three accents - one for the home, one for school and one for when they are out with their 'mates'.
The "posh" one for school, the not quite so "posh" one for home, and the "Quarry Bonker", language out.
The language can be understood except for sayings like "'ers givin' me the jedi" or "Yoda" meaning "she's staring at me, or "that's mass," meaning that's big. The language has changed over the years.
